Class ImageDescriptors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.diffplug.common.swt.ImageDescriptors

  • public class ImageDescriptors
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for using ImageDescriptors correctly.

    • Method Detail

      • createSetter

        public static com.diffplug.common.base.Box.Nullable<org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor> createSetter(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget lifecycle,
                                                                                                             java.util.function.Supplier<org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image> imageGetter,
                                                                                                             java.util.function.Consumer<org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image> imageSetter)
        ImageDescriptor allows an image to be shared in a pool using reference counting. In order to not screw-up the reference counting, you need to be pretty careful with how you use them. This creates a Box.Nullable which sets and gets images in a way that will keep the reference counting happy. NO ONE MUST SET THE IMAGE EXCEPT THIS SETTER.
        Parameters:
        lifecycle - Any outstanding images will be destroyed with the lifecycle of this Widget.
        imageGetter - Function which returns the image being gotten.
        imageSetter - Function which sets the image being set.
        Returns:

      • set

        public static void set(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Item widget,
                       org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor image)
        Sets the given Item to have the image described by the given descriptor, maintaining proper reference counting.
